intro: Cordia evolutior, commonly known as the broadleaf cordia, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often ovate or elliptic in shape. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, followed by small, fleshy fruits that contain several seeds. Cordia evolutior is adapted to grow in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained conditions and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
